de.thkoeln.bibl.api.lms.slnp.transfer

Class DataResponse

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.thkoeln.bibl.api.lms.slnp.transfer.Transfer<T>
      • de.thkoeln.bibl.api.lms.slnp.transfer.Response<ResponseMessage>
        • de.thkoeln.bibl.api.lms.slnp.transfer.DefaultResponse
          • de.thkoeln.bibl.api.lms.slnp.transfer.DataResponse
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    LoginResponse, MultiDataResponse

    public class DataResponse
extends DefaultResponse
    Implements a SLNP data response. It's extends the DefaultResponse with it's key/value message handling.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DataResponse(Connectable con)
      Initialize a new DataResponse with an object that implements the connectable interface.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DataResponse

        public DataResponse(Connectable con)
             throws java.lang.ReflectiveOperationException
        Initialize a new DataResponse with an object that implements the connectable interface.
        Parameters:
        con - a reference to a connectable object. This reference will be used to communicate with the server
        Throws:
        java.lang.ReflectiveOperationException - if the response message dosn't support the required initialization functionality

    • Method Detail

      • parse

        public void parse()
        Parse all received data messages.

      • getData

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getData()
        Returns the parsed data as key/value map.
        Returns:
        the data as map, indexed with the message key

      • getData

        public java.lang.String getData(java.lang.String key)
        Returns the parsed data for a specific key.
        Parameters:
        key - the key for which the data should be received
        Returns:
        the received data

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid()
        Checks if the received response is a valid SLNP data response.
        Overrides:
        isValid in class Transfer<ResponseMessage>
        Returns:
        true if the response is valid
        See Also:
